pr_title: Getting single blob should avoid Cosmos

timeline.bodyText: Will update test case for this.
timeline.author: lightningrob

timeline.bodyText: Why do we want to avoid cosmos here? Because of consistency concern between ABS and cosmos (but that should apply to all cases) OR coz cosmos is more costly?
timeline.author: ankagrawal

replies.bodyText: We don't want the extra round trip of going to cosmos (note that with this change there will still be two round trips to ABS, so there is additional work to do).  And it will be expensive to query Cosmos on every GET/Getinfo request.
replies.author: lightningrob

timeline.author: zzmao

replies.bodyText: Yes.  Azure client throws IllegalStateException on timeouts.  Given the amount of different exceptions being thrown, I gave up and decided to catch them all.  If we do get a RuntimeException from our own code, we should still see it in the log.
replies.author: lightningrob

timeline.bodyText: nit: extra parentheses around the method call
timeline.author: cgtz

timeline.bodyText: When would this case happen vs. the method throwing a not found BlobStorageException?
timeline.author: cgtz

replies.bodyText: Technically it shouldn't, but I figured it was safer to check.
replies.author: lightningrob

timeline.bodyText: is info level too high for this log message, since the CloudStorageException can be caught and logged at a higher level?
timeline.author: cgtz

replies.bodyText: I added this mainly to log the status code which is useful for debugging and which gets lost in the CloudStorageException.  I will reduce to debug if we see too many of them.
replies.author: lightningrob

timeline.bodyText: not directly related to this patch, but can you change Long id into long id. No need to use a boxed long if it is non-nullable.
timeline.author: cgtz

timeline.bodyText: Did we find a case where a clustermap was returning a non-singleton AmbryPartition instance to require a hashcode? Not necessarily against having it since this can be a big gotcha when writing cluster aware code or test cases. However, if there are cases where PartitionId is found to have multiple instances for the same partition number, we should track them down since this class holds some state regarding sealed/stopped replicas.
timeline.author: cgtz

replies.bodyText: I'm not sure.  The frequency of cache misses (even repeated ones causing 3 retries to fail) made me suspicious but I have no proof of that.
replies.author: lightningrob

timeline.message:
Getting single blob should avoid Cosmos
Add cache hit counter for CloudBlobStore
Frontend uploads blob regardless of TTL
Handle IllegalStateException on ABS timeouts
AmbryPartition overrides equals and hashcode
Add blobCacheLookup counter and fix test cases
Handle case where ABS operation throws PrematureCloseException
